result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Matthew Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $1,086.31 to Rebecca H.  Bail to apply.  Victim is to be paid first before the court costs and assessments.

Pay the DNA surcharge (for the felony charge), costs and disbursements for counts one through three by the end of probationary period.  Should defendant get revoked and be sent to prison, Court ordered monies taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would then be paid while on Extended supervision.
Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
Undergo a mental health evaluation.  Follow thru with any treatment recommended.

No contact with Rebecca H.
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant for his mental or physical needs by a duly licensed physician. Take as prescribed and only for as long as deemed medically reasonable and necessary.
No alcohol.

Anger management counseling.
Parenting classes.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes: AS TO COUNTS TWO AND THREE:  Pay costs and disbursements while on probation on count one.

04-05-2019/ Judge Janet Protasiewicz  
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to state that the defendant is entitled to 78 days of sentence credit counts two and three for the period of August 5, 2015 to October 21, 2015.

12-28-2018/ Judge Janet Protasiewicz for Glenn H Yamahiro       
The Court ordered that the stay of the sentences on counts two and three is hereby lifted, requiring service of those sentences forthwith.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.  Report date stayed to 8/5/15 at 5:00 p.m.
 Huber for work and childcare.  Good time allowed.
78 days of sentence credit

12-28-2018/ Judge Janet Protasiewicz for Glenn H. Yamahiro      
The Court ordered that the stay of the sentences on counts two and three is hereby lifted, requiring service of those sentences forthwith.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two.
**10/15/2015  Sentence on counts two and three is STAYED.  STAY on counts two and trhee to commence upon payment of cash bail set by the Court in the amount of $6,000.00.
78 days of sentence credit.

/filed.
/for Return/Destruction of Exhibits, received and filed.

The Court found defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2, and 3 as charged in the Information.  Court advised defendant that as to Count 1, the felony charge, he is now a convicted felon and that he may not use or possess firearms or body armor.  Defendant was also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  State requested a separate sentencing date to allow for victim notification and requested that defendant be remanded.  Arguments heard.  Court granted State's request for a separate sentencing date but denied remanding the defendant at this time.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue, including No Contact Orders, and ordered case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20 on 7/29/15 at 8:30 a.m.  File retained in court.

Defendant Eric Matthew Jones in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised the court that his client elects to not testify.  Court had colloquy with defendant and finds that defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntariliy waived his right to testify.  Defense rests.  No rebuttal testimony.  State rests. Court ordered testimonial phase of court trial closed.  Arguments heard.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
/of Trial by Jury, received and filed.

Defendant Eric Matthew Jones in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled for the afternoon reporter.  Court trial commences.  Sworn for the State:  Ms. Rebecca H.; Ms. Brenda K.; Mr. Bradley S.; Ms. Lindsey S.; Exhibits #1 thru #9  offered and received. State rests, subject to rebuttal.  Court has colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify and his right to not testify.  Defense counsel requested that his client be allowed to state his decision tomorrow morning.  Court granted defense request.  Court in recess until 9:00 a.m. on July 16, 2015 before Branch 20.

Defendant Eric Matthew Jones in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advise the court that case remains in trial posture.  Jury instructions gone over and ruled upon.  Court grants Defense motion for sequestration of  witnesses.  Court passed case to allow defense counsel to go to his other court and to continue with morning calendar.

Case recalled. Same appearances noted for the record.  Defense counsel advised the State and the Court that his client wishes to waive his right to trial by jury and instead requested a court trial.  Waiver of Jury Trial signed and filed.  Court has colloquy with defendant regarding his right to have a trial by jury.  Court found that defendant willingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived his right to trial by jury.  Motions in limine heard; parties stipulate to defendant's number of convictions.  Court ordered case passed to 2:00 p.m.
/and Restitution Worksheet, filed.
Defense Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Eric Matthew Jones in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Defense still in a contest posture.  Parties prepared to proceed to trial.  Case remains set for Jury Trial before Branch 20 on 7-15-15 at 8:30 a.m.

Court set the following due dates for any motions filed:  movant has until 5/18/15 to file any motions; response due by 6/08/15; reply due by 6/15/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one (1) week of the final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
